intro: Psychotria auriculata, commonly known as the "ear-shaped psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Due to its psychoactive properties, it has been used in traditional rituals and is also studied for its potential medicinal applications.
